New Records: Netherlands’ van Beek, Engelbrecht break the Dhoni-Jadeja’s ODI World Cup partnership record for seventh wicket
Key Match Events: Samarawickrama gets three runs as he drills one through extra cover
Asalanka breaks the shackles to bludgeon the first six of the innings
Hemantha steps out to thump the winner down the ground for four as Sri Lanka wins by five wickets
Sri Lanka needs 21 off 30. Samarawickrama is 14 away from a century
Samarawickrama provides too much room outside off, and he uses the freebie to dab a boundary past backward point
Pre-Game Insights: Kusal Mendis: We have three injuries. We have to do well in both batting and bowling, hope we do in today’s game.
Scott Edwards: We are going to have a bat first. The pitch looks pretty good, hopefully put a score on and look to defend it.
Post-Match Reflections: This is now the highest successful run chase at the venue!
After eight successive losses in ODIs, this also happens to be Sri Lanka’s first win in India.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
